abstract: A bus company in Brooklyn serving a largely Hasidic and Orthodox Jewish clientele denied that it discriminates against female passengers by forcing them to sit at the rear of the bus.
snippet: A bus company in Brooklyn serving a largely Hasidic and Orthodox Jewish clientele denied that it discriminates against female passengers by forcing them to sit at the rear of the bus.
lead_paragraph: A bus company that transports primarily Orthodox and Hasidic Jewish passengers between Williamsburg and Borough Park in Brooklyn has denied that it discriminates against female passengers by compelling them to sit at the rear of the bus.

headline.main: Bus Operator Denies Discriminating Against Women
